mucke.util

Class Logger

  • java.lang.Object
    • mucke.util.Logger

  • public class Logger
extends Object
    Simple, flexible logging facility for comma separated log files

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Logger(String[] columnHeaders)
      Logging facility

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean close()
      Closes the log
      void flush()
      Flushes the logger so that all text is written to the logfile

      Logs current log with its values as set with setColumnValue

      Writes a log of columns, represented in a String array, directly to the logging file.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Logger

        public Logger(String[] columnHeaders)
        Logging facility

    • Method Detail

      • log

        public boolean log(String[] columns)
        Writes a log of columns, represented in a String array, directly to the logging file. Checks the number of columns with the number of column headers when the Logger was created and throws an error if they differ.
        Parameters:
        String[] - columns
        Returns:
        true if the log was successfully writen, false otherwise

      • resetColumns

        public void resetColumns()
        Resets current columns of the current log entry

      • setColumn

        public void setColumn(String name,
             String value)
        Sets the given column of the log file format
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the column as defined during instantiation
        value - String value of the column

      • log

        public void log()
        Logs current log with its values as set with setColumnValue

      • resetRank

        public void resetRank()
        Resets the rank to its inital position

      • flush

        public void flush()
        Flushes the logger so that all text is written to the logfile

      • close

        public boolean close()
        Closes the log

      • main

        public static void main(String[] args)
        For testing only
